nodes.bodyText: For compatibility reasons, you want to keep the parameters the same. eg. 0 = map pool, 1 = player name. Same with the other translation.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -73,14 +73,14 @@ map.protectPortal = You may not obstruct this area
 # {0} = map pool name (e.g. "Mega")
 pool.change = Map pool has been set to {0} in order to better adjust to the current player count.
 
-# {0} = map pool name (e.g. "Mega")
-# {1} = player name
-pool.change.force = The map pool has been set to {0} by {1}
-
-# {0} = map pool name (e.g. "Mega")
-# {1} = a duration (e.g. "2 hours")
-# {2} = player name
-pool.change.forceTimed = The map pool has been set to {0} for {1} by {2}
+# {0} = player name
+# {1} = map pool name (e.g. "Mega")
+pool.change.force = {0} set the map pool to {1}

nodes.bodyText: I sent you a message regarding clarification on this one. Thanks

nodes.bodyText: Tracking who queued the restart isn't really needed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,10 +24,12 @@
       perms = Permissions.STOP)
   public void restart(
       Audience audience,
+      CommandSender sender,

nodes.bodyText: I think this is over-verbosity on messages, we already have restart message.

Just to clarify, are you referring to the /queuerestart broadcast as well or should both be removed?
Update: I removed the /cancelrestart broadcast, though the /queuerestart broadcast is still there. I believe it will be useful, however if you want it removed just say so.
